ab.title: Genesis 43
ab.l: Andthe famine became stronger in the land.
And it was, whenthey had finished to eat up the grain which they had broughtfrom Egypt, that their father said to them, ‘Go again, buyus a little grain.’
And Judah saidto him, saying, ‘The man certified to us,saying, “You shall not see my face, if your brother is notwith you.”
If you are sending our brotherwith us, we will go down and buy you grain.
And if you are not sending, we will not go down, because theman said to us, “You shall not see my face, if your brother is notwith you.”’
And Israel said, ‘Why have you doneme wrong, to tell the man whether you had a brother?’

And they said, ‘The man asked about usand about our kindred, saying, “Is your father still alive?Do you have another brother?” And we told him according to these words.Could we have known that he would say, “Bring your brother down”?’
And Judah said to Israel, his father, ‘Sendthe boy with me, and let us arise and go, and let us live andnot die, we and you and our infants as well.
Let me take the responsibilityfor him. From my hand you shall seek him. If I do not bring him to you,and if I do not set him before you, then I will sin against you for all the days.
For if we had not delayed, by now we would have returnedthese two times.’

And Israel, their father, said to them‘If that is how it is here, do this: Take of the excellentfruits in the land in your vessels, and carry down the mana present: a little balm, and a little honey, spices, andmastic, pistachio nuts, and almonds.
And take double the silverin your hand; and the silver that was brought backin the mouth of your sacks, take it again in your hand. Maybeit was an oversight.
And take your brother, and arise,go back to the man.
And may the mighty God give youmercy before the man, that he may send your otherbrother and Benjamin to you. And I: when I was deprived ofJosef, so were I deprived of Simeon.’
Andthe men took that present, and they took double the silverin their hand and Benjamin. And they rose up andwent down to Egypt and stood before Joseph.

AndJoseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to him whowas to the superior of his house, ‘Bring these mento the room, and slaughter and make ready |an animal|,because these men will eat with me at noon.’
And the man did as Joseph told him, and the man brought themen to Joseph’s house.

And the men were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph’s house,and they said, ‘Because of the silver that was returned in our sacksthe first time are we brought in, that he may seek a pretext against us, and†tie and close us, and take us for slaves — andour donkeys.
And they came near to the manthat was the superior over Joseph’s house, and they spokewith him at the door of the house.
And they said,‘We pray you, my lord, we came down the first time to buygrain.

And it was, when we came to the place of overnight stay,that we opened our sacks, and, lo, every man’s silverwas in the mouth of his sack, our silver in its |full| weight. And we have brought it backin our hand.
And we have brought other silverdown in or hand to buy grain. We do not know who putour silver in our sacks.’
And he said,‘Welfare to you, do not be afraid. Your God and the God of your fatherhas given you treasure in your sacks: Your silver reachedme.’ And he brought Simeon out to them.
Andthe man brought the men to Joseph’s house,and gave them water, and they washed their feet, and he gave food for their donkeys.
And they made ready thepresent for Joseph’s coming at noon because they heardthat they will eat bread there.
And Joseph cameto the room, and they brought the present for him whichwas in their hand to the room, and bowed themselves to him to the ground.
And he asked them of their health, and said,‘Is your old father of whom you spoke in |good| health? Is he still alive?’
And they answered, ‘Your servant, our father, is in |good| health. He is stillalive.’ And they bowed down, and bowed themselves.
Andhe raised his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin,his mother’s son, and said, ‘Is this your younger brother,of whom you spoke to me?’ And he said, ‘God be merciful to you,my son.’
And Joseph hurried because his compassion grew warmfor his brother. And he came to weep and entered his chamberand wept there.
And he washed his face, and went out,and strengthened himself, and said, ‘Put the bread.’

Andthey served him separately, and them separately, and for the Egyptians,who did eat with him, separately, because the Egyptians could noteat bread with the Hebrews, because that is an abominationto Egypt.
And they sat before him,the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngeraccording to his youth. And the men were amazedlooking at one another.
And he liftedgifts to them from before Josef, but Benjamin’s giftwas five times more than the gift of all of them.And they drank, and got drunk with him.
